title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 363.2 - Reimbursement applicability -part A
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 363.2 - Reimbursement applicability -part A
State Regulations

Districts shall be eligible for reimbursement by the State to
the extent of 50 percent of the amount expended by the district, up to $60,000
per district in any fiscal year, for the employment of conservation field
technicians or district managers and the purchase of supplies and equipment
related to these positions, for the purpose of supervising or providing
technical assistance for the establishment and implementation of soil and water
conservation practices in accordance with programs undertaken by the district
pursuant to the provisions of section 11-a(1)( a) of the New York State Soil
and Water Conservation Districts Law. For the purposes of this section, the
soil and water conservation district of New York City shall be considered the
equivalent of five districts. Notes

York State Register February 5, 2020/Volume XLII, Issue 05, eff. 2/5/2020

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
